reviews.review:
I'm a real big chicken when it comes to horror elements in games, and I was hesitant to pick this game up at first. When I finally got around to trying this out, I ended up on the Suburbia map with no clue what to do. It's really easy to pick up the rules though, especially for someone who likes co-op FPS games. 

The game is based off the most recent Unreal engine, so the layout of the server browser and the communication panel is familiar (even for someone whose most recent Unreal game was UT2004). If you missed playing Invasion mode on UT2004, this is your alternative. There's a weight/hinderance system, but beyond that, if you're looking for realistic player damage (like say, CoD), this might not be to your taste -- it's a zombie game after all....

Do you like Zombies? Chainsaw? Shooting people in the face for being naked? Cups of tea? LOADS AH EMONE!? Then Killing Florr is a game for you! Your objective is to fend off thousands of angry zombie (Well, not really zombie, but really, who can tell without being told?) streakers as they try to cross London naked, killing (and we assume eatting) everyone in their path. You and up to 5 others must fend off increasingly hard waves of enemys in a plethora of open ended stages that let you hold up anywhere you can. 

Which is important, when the BIG MAN comes....

Unlike Left 4 Dead, the Clots in this game feel like proper zombies. However, the addition of giant chainsaw behemoths and mutilated demi-humans with flamethrowers for hands adds an extra element of enjoyment. Toss in a bunch of unique and fun weapons, and you've got quite the game.

Though, Different from the L4D Series. This game still remains to be one of the first games i bought on steam since I joined. With constant balance changes, updates, and dlc content. You can't go wrong with this game. The community is still very much alive. unlike Unreal Tournament 3 Black Edition.

It'll take you hundreds of hours before you even scratch the surface of a level 6 perk.

Community is very friendly/ harsh at some times because teamwork is a must in this game hence CO-OP. 

With no PvP It can still blow YOUR MIND. 

Play this at night with sound and music on high and by yourself. And you've got one DEADLY experience you can't miss.

GL & HF...
Such a simple game, But SOOOOO much fun.

One of those hard-to-appreciate games since, we have to admit, the graphics are a little dated. Ignoring this fact, the game is nevertheless exceptional in its main theme, which is zombies, or in this game's case, Specimens.

What drives you to play is what most of the games either lack or contain too much: variety. It has a good enough amount of it that you can actually enjoy playing it without replaying the same game every time. It also doesn't have so much of it that you'll lose track of the basis of "balance"

A really noticeable (and very annoying) con of this game is its communication system. Microphones have bad quality and lag like heck. You're probably at your best if you visit a server that offers its own teamspeak or mumble server (which is really really rare). Second to that are the pubs. If you felt that Team Fortress 2 or Modern Warfare had bad pubs, this game has it worse.

All in all, this game is worth buying when played with friends or people that agree.

Killing Floor is the next generation of mindless destruction of Zombies on and around the Brittish Islands. Most fun I've had in ages. Get on it when the game is cheap and lets murder the undead! *and no this is not an automated add*.
Mighty Chicken
Nice game!

DOSH! GRAB IT WHILE ITS HOT! Oh yes, British humour in the face of death. WHERES MY BENEFITS CHEQUE?! Quite. Point of the game is simple, you with your mates against a horde of varous difficult enemies. Wave after wave of pure bloody comical fun. Always fuelled with your characters quotes. Classics like "I'm welding this doar" and "Money, money, money". You survive, you buy, you kill. There's not much more to this concept.

The game is based on the old UT2k4 engine, hence why its perfectly playable on most medicore and even basic systems. With lucious, not "in your face" shiny textures and power, this is the game where you've got your mates and just want to blast your way to fun.

4 / 5
最初はホラー。慣れるとコメディ。
Better than L4D2 in various ways and a lot more fun, the more waves you complete the harder enemies appear, also maxing the perks adds a bit more of challenge to an already entertaining game.

Boring, buggy, and filled with obnoxious music, glitchy or unrefined maps, mediocre models, and the worst voice acting I've heard in an American game. I can't play this for more than an hour at a time. It's the same silly thing over and over -- shoot lots of things in the head with a pistol. Some people seem to really love it to death though, so get it if you don't believe me. Or if you like two British people talking nonstop all around you for extended periods of time in a shooting gallery while lots of the worst heavy metal music ever keeps playing.
Christene mentioned this I beleive - it is amazing try it!

I cannot think of a single game that has more shootsploding or killdeathing than Killing Floor, and that's not just because these aren't words.  This game is coop only, but don't let that fool you into thinking it won't be a challenge.  A literal catalog of things that go boom makes the brutality of this game second-to-none and the progression system will get any sad unfulfilled person addicted if you need someone to play with.

(torching endless hordes of zombies is so satisfying sometimes ^_^) i know some casual servers and a super mod server thats tons of fun.

Do you enjoy killing zombies?  Well with Killing Floor, you can shred them, chop them, gib them, roast them, pepper them, or turn their heads into a fine, red mist.  Better hope you have a medic to back you up though.

Killing floor gives what few FPSes can...a feeling of self-improvement. Achievements are nice...but getting to bust out that favourite weapon sooner because you were diligent in learning to use it and its cousins feels even better. The rules are best learned on the fly for new people, and you'll seldom feel too stupid to be playing, especially with a community willing to back you up when you stumble.

I hope they make a 2nd part with an improved engine but it doen't mean KF isn't bad either, just dated looks but game play should keep you coming back for more.

Effin' wonderful coop shooter.  Like L4d but instead of a story, it lets you aim down the sights of your weapons.  Tons of fun.  Perks/classes so you can make progress, tons and tons of maps, and absolutely requires teamwork.  Cheap, too - pick it up and we can play!
A true test of skill and teamwork, all wrapped up in about 3 feet of blood and guts.

Review:
An FPS game where you:

>Select a specialty
>Level this specialty up
>Getting to level 6 takes a while
>Good game to play with friends or solo
>You can throw money
>You can throw money at the end of the game as a victory
>LOADSEMONEY!

Zombie killing coop at its finest. Instead of L4D's four players, you have six. Instead of L4D's 2 hour games, you have up to ten waves of zombies, each lasting about five minutes. Instead of L4D's scavenging and fighting over who gets to use the chainsaw, you have a merit based shopping system.

If you want to feel more like a soldier fighting a zombie apocalypse than a survivor fleeing it, then Killing Floor is the game for you.

this is a great survival horror that has single and multiplayer and no campaign :3 this game has a pretty good range of guns has different classes you can play as well different perks you can choose i should say such as berserker,medic,sharpshooter,etc. and you can play as any character you want (character packs available) so if your into killing some zombies and mutants with your pals than get this game and start the slaughter :D
christmas was kool D: :D D: :D

Отличный командный survival-horror, где надо РЕАЛЬНО думать головой и помогать товарищам. Есть перки, много оружия (включая ближнего боя) и много врагов. Можно выбрать одного из множества героев или купить DLC с другими персонажами. В общем, у Killing Floor много плюсов. Из минусов только графика эдак 2007 года.
go c fun

This was one my first PC games, back in 2010, when i first entered Steam. I got it on a Sale and, for a time, Killing Floor was the only game i was able to play on my old Intel onboard graphic card. I made many friends playing this game and had hundreds of hours of fun. Now, almost 6 years later, KF is still one of the best co op games i've ever played in my life. It's not a hard game to get good at, playing with other people or by yourself, there's a great variety of modded content along with the official stuff released through the years by Tripwire. The hardware requirements are, of course, not really high, and although the graphics can look quite outdated, this doesn't stop all the fun the game can provide.
"Хорошо сбалансированнный командный шутер"

Killing Floor suffers from lack of polish, but does resemble a fairly decent coop survival shooter with subtle RPG elements. The game fundamentals are solid even with the lack of continuity by chasing down a trader for gun and ammo purchases between hordes of zombies. For casual players, the RPG elements are much too serious a grind to reach maximum level. The developers continue to put time and effort into keeping the game popular and fun with sales events and new DLC. It's not all that fun to play by yourself, but certainly plenty of entertainment for you and your mates together.
Addictive multiplayer game, awesome for LAN's or playing with random people on the internet.
A classic zombie game, with a very amusing British-accent twist.

More tactical than L4D and can run on pretty much anything.
Cheap too !!
Great game and a bit under appreciated by some, on par if not better than valve's left 4 dead games
this game is a game

Piove, l'atmosfera è lugubre.
Con i pochi compagni di squadra rimasti entrate in una stazione di polizia deserta e cominciate a barricarvi all'interno. L'agitazione e la paura sono nell'aria mentre preparate le vostre armi. Sentite rumori angoscianti al di fuori delle porte: urla disumane, ruggiti, lame che raschiano il terreno e grida capaci di farvi saltare la testa. Arrivano.
Preparate il dito sul grilletto e prendete la mira mentre le mostruosità all'esterno si abbattono sulla porta davanti a voi.
Non c'è via di scampo, bisogna eliminarli tutti o morire nel tentativo.
Benvenuti in Killing Floor.

Possibly one of the most fun, exciting, and suspenseful games out there. The multiplayer teamwork is amazing (single-player is also VERY fun) with class choices (medic, bezerker, commando, support specialist, firebug, demolitions) and a unique arsenal of weapons (and yes.... there IS a chainsaw). You can level up each class/perk  with each rank up offering new bonuses and discounts (discounts on weapons).

The maps are awesome, ranging from night and day maps, and urban and farmland areas. Its crazy fun.

If you love FPS's, zombies, teamwork,  gore, headshots, voice chat, horror,  flashlights, survivial, and a touch of strategy and skill, then this game was created for YOU!

Haha ok, well my review is over. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME!

Left 4 Dead fica no chinelo perto desse Survival Horror. Sozinho aqui vc não é nada, só mais um banquete para os mortos vivos. Esse jogo define muito bem o significado de cooperação, ajuda mútua aqui é fundamental para o sucesso do seu esquadrão. É dar suporte para os amigos e sentar o dedo nessa p***ra. Com 5 classes distintas para vc passar de level e aprimorar suas armas e habilidades, killing floor está no top dos jogos co-op de matança aos zumbis. Nota 10.

An interesting take on the Survival Co-op Zombies genre. Although this game is mainly known for its difficulty, its a great choice to have.

This game is based on the Unreal Tournament 2004 engine but it is its own stand-alone game. If you plan on playing by yourself, you better be playing on Short Games + Easy difficulty, this game is a tough one if you aren't with other people.

Aside from its rampant difficulty, its rather fun to play, much worth the bucks they are asking for, if you see it on the Steam deals then you better scoop it up right away!

I don't know exactly what about this game appeals to me, but it really does. If anything, I can say it's fun and engaging. I've met good people through KF as well. Definitely worth buying when it's on sale. (I'm cheap about my game purchases on steam.)

One really has to appreciate the on-going developer support that this game gets, even though they are kind of deaf to most pleas of the community.. Oh well, still it is a good idea to get it once it's very lowly priced again and you should find this to be a gift that keeps on giving, and it delivers all the mindless violence fun that keeps us coming back to it.
